name: Python FastAPI Service PRD
description: Async Python service built with FastAPI, Pydantic models, and PostgreSQL persistence.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Backend service exposes RESTful endpoints with automatic OpenAPI docs, async performance, and strong typing.

sections.title: Functional Requirements
sections.content: CRUD endpoints, JWT authentication, background tasks, pagination, health checks.

sections.title: Non-Functional Requirements
sections.content: P95 latency under 150ms, 99.9% uptime, structured logging, observability via OpenTelemetry.

sections.title: Technical Stack
sections.content: Python 3.12+, FastAPI, Pydantic v2, SQLAlchemy 2, Alembic, PostgreSQL, uvicorn.

sections.title: Data Model
sections.content: Entities: User, Subscription, Invoice, WebhookEvent. Relationships: User-Subscription (1:N); Subscription-Invoice (1:N). Alembic migrations versioned per release.

sections.title: Example Endpoints
sections.content: POST /v1/subscriptions {plan_id,user_id} → 201; GET /v1/invoices?user_id → 200 [..]; POST /v1/webhooks/stripe (signed) → 202. Include OpenAPI examples and Pydantic models.

sections.title: SLOs & Alerts
sections.content: Targets: p95 < 150ms, uptime 99.9%. Alerts: warn p95 > 180ms 5m; crit p95 > 300ms 10m; DB error rate > 1% 5m.

sections.title: Security
sections.content: JWT validation, token revocation list, RBAC for routes, parameterized SQL to avoid injection, secrets from env/vault, rate limits per key.

technology_profile.notes: Optimised for async IO workloads with auto-generated schemas using Pydantic.

api_guidance.name: Stripe Billing API
api_guidance.rationale: Handles subscription billing with webhook-based lifecycle events and first-class Python SDK.

api_guidance.name: SendGrid Mail API
api_guidance.rationale: Provides transactional email delivery with templating and analytics.
